headline: Key Lime Pie I
description: Beaten egg whites are carefully folded into the lovely lime filling to create a light and airy texture. The pie is baked in a graham cracker crust, frozen and topped with freshly whipped cream just before serving.

video.description: Creamy pie that’s sweet, refreshing, and full of citrus flavors.
video.name: Key Lime Pie I

name: Key Lime Pie I

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Mix graham cracker crumbs with sugar and melted butter. Press into 9 inch pie plate and bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
Separate 2 of the eggs, placing the two egg whites into a mixing bowl. Reserve the yolks in another bowl.

To the yolks, add one whole egg, lime juice and sweetened condensed milk. Whisk until smooth. With clean mixer blades or a whisk attachment, beat the egg whites with salt and cream of tartar until stiff, but not dry. Fold whites into filling mixture. Pour filling into partially baked crust.

Bake in preheated 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 10 to 15 minutes or until set. Let cool at room temperature, then freeze 4 hours to overnight. Just before serving, whip cream to form stiff peaks. Serve decorated with whipped cream and lime slices.

review.reviewBody: I’ve never made Key Lime Pie before but a family member loves it so I made it for his birthday. He & everyone else loved it! I didn’t

this is such an awesome recipe. At first I thought I would be the "chef" and squeeze 13 limes. After painful hands and wrists, I found a bottle of Key Lime juice at the grocery store.. MUCH EASIER!
I like making the crust from scratch. It's much tastier than the store bought one. I love eating this pie too!
Added 1 & 1/2 teaspoons of sugar and lemon extract about a dash to whipping cream

The filling was great! I changed the crust, using 1 1/4 Cups crushed Mr. Christie's chocolate wafers instead of Graham crackers and added 1 teaspoon cocoa powder. Suggest using additional egg whites to make meringue and bake the meringue with the pie, rather than using whipped cream after baking the pie.

Well, this is a keeper. In Canada, our sweetened condensed milk comes in 300 ml. cans (10.5 oz.), so I used 2 cans & added an extra whole egg. And, even though I had to use concentrated lime juice from a bottle, it turned out great. Took it to a family BBQ, where it was a huge hit.
I had to make my own sweetened condensed milk so i took a lot longer to cook because it wasn't as thick as the canned stuff. Loved it.

This was very simple to make and was delicious. I first made it with regular limes and it was a hit. Second time I made two with key limes and was praised even more. I decorated 3 different ways. I will make this often!!!!!
Amazing, my family downs this in 1 day here is the one from the fourth of July I split the batter into different bowls and colored them the mixed them together to create this pie.
I made this exactly as the recipe said except I didn’t have key limes so I used regular limes. It was amazing. A big hit at our Memorial Day gathering.
Great recipe, as is. Used GOOD key lime juice...Nellie and Joe’s. Pie looked, tasted authentic.
It was too limey. Any other ingredients to put in to cut that tast? I used Nellie Key lime juice. Any recommendations for a different lime juice
Turned out perfect!

This recipe was easy, light and delicious!
I decorated it with chopped strawberries in maple syrup, and slices of kiwi, beautiful colors with the yellow pie, I would definitely make this again, my single guest for Corvid -19 Easter Sunday loved it!
I've already reviewed the pie, but wanted to share for those of you that can't find key limes...Amazon has a bottle of key lime juice
This is not a traditional custard type key lime pie' but it is light and delicious. Everyone loved it! I will definitely make it again.
The pie turned out delicious,,, since I am from Fl., I know Key Lime pie!! Will definitely use this receipe again
I add some lime zest to the top of the pie before baking, it adds a little kick. I also do an Italian Meringue instead of whipped cream. Keeping it frozen until serving helps.
yum
Love the Key Lime pie.
I did not make any changes and i will make it again for sure.

My wife and I love REAL Key Lime Pie and this is better then 90% of the muck you can get even in South Florida. I did no changes, I usually don't on the first try on this recipe there will be none on the second or third and ..... well you get the idea.
Easy to follow instructions!
I frozen aspect was problematic. No trouble freezing just serving and storing. I will not make again.
Easy and delicious! What more can you ask for?

I am lactose-intolerant, so I used vegan butter for the crust and sweetened condensed coconut milk in the filling. My pie took more than 15 minutes baking time to set, but i’m Not sure if that’s due to the coconut milk or my oven. I could not find key limes, so I just used regular ones and a tiny bit of zest. I also added 1/2 tsp of ground ginger to the crust. The pie has a pleasant flavor. It is very sweet.
Really delicious and easy to make! I was nervous when it wasn’t green, but yellowish key lime pie is just as delicious!

I have never tasted key lime pie so, I am in no way a critic here. But, I will admit to one truth, this came out wonderful and my family loved it. It was light and had the perfect amount of tang, loved it! I have never even seen key limes or juice in our area so I mixed half lime with half lemon juice like a few other reviewers suggested. I also had to let it bake for about five minutes extra. Other than that, I followed it perfectly and we all enjoyed every bite. Thank you for sharing! (Also, to those who are key lime pie experts, if all you want is the real thing then I suggest you plan a vacation instead of reviewing a recipe like you are Gordon Ramsey. These are simply recipes to try at home, not a contest).

turned out well, but colour isn't as green as the photo. I added in coconut oil instead of butter, and more lime juice instead of cream of tartar. I also added lime zest, and coconut shreds to the filling.
Good, but very sweet. Easy to make
This is my favorite recipe and I do freeze it. When ready to eat, I only thaw enough to remove slices. I usually top with cool whip.

The directions are a touch confusing because of the way they're broken down. Read everything before you start and you should be fine. Next time I'll add an and extra held cup of graham cracker crumbs so I don't feel like I'm spreading the crust too thin. The pie itself was excellent! I don't think I've had anything closer to true key lime. It was a hit for my fiancés "birthday pie". I'll be making this again soon.
My family loved it!!!! So tasty and now I make it for special dinners and there is never left overs.
Not a traditional key lime pie. Key limes will give a pale yellow filling, never green. This is probably a Persian lime type of pie. Different.
Great pie! Easy to make! Great for family gatherings or just for fun!
Recipe is easy to follow but actually needs more lime juice than what was called for. Regardless it was tasty and next time I make it I’ll increase the amount of juice.

I went with six tbsp butter and brown sugar in the crust. In the pie itself I also added 1/2 cup of sour cream to smooth out the initial tartness of the key limes. I also add in the zest of about 5-7 key limes however in a pinch the zest of two regular limes will do as well. I make mine in a 10.5 in springform pan so i usually have to double the recipe to get it to even out. I've been serving this at my kitchen for the past few weeks now, in Florida. All the locals love it and I'm getting asked for the recipe constantly from other chefs in the area. Great pie here, and thanks.
More detailed than other versions, but well worth the effort.
I loved it! The tart pie with the sweet crust is the perfect combination!

This was my first key lime pie. I made two changes: instead of using a pinch of salt, I used 3 tablespoons of sugar for the merengue. I tried using salt, but it came out very watery. And instead of mixing the merengue and the filling, I put the merengue on top as most key lime pies are. Very yummy, definitely making this again! And I think i found a typo... It says "1 cup of heavy whipping cream" in the ingredients list and nowhere does it say when to use it!

It is delicious ! Light and tangy with just right amount of sweetness . Not a rich pie like no-bake condensed milk recipe yet very creamy, smooth and fluffy. I followed exactly it says and I baked it twice. Both came out the same. Really good Key Lime Pie recipe. I will treasure it. Thank you!!
This key lime pie was a hit. I get requests for it every time somebody in my family brings up desserts now.
We did not like this pie.
Made it per the recipe. Delicious! People always ask for seconds on this one. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
This pie is just like the one my grandmother made. I don't change a thing, and it's always perfect.

Amazing! It worked so well and my family thought it was delisious! The gram cracker crust tastes great with the texture is smooth but thick. I would advise you to use this recipe for parties or just a desert at home.
This was a great recipe! Tasted great, but it didn't hold very well when taking it out of the pan.

This is an awesome pie! I couldn't find key limes so I used 1/4 cup lime juice and 1/4 lemon juice. For the whipped cream I used 1 cup heavy whipping cream, three tablespoons of powdered sugar and 1/2 tsp vanilla (my favorite whipped cream recipe). It was very light and with lots of citrus flavor. I also used a prebaked crust and had no trouble getting out of the pan. I found it needed about 18 - 20 minutes to cook to firm up. It cooled for an hour then I put it in the freezer for two hours before we ate it. I think the firmness was from the extra cook time rather than the freezer but either way it was delicious. I would definitely make this again!

Decadent and rich!! I made tartlets in muffin pans and the turned out beautifully!! I cut the sugar in the crust recipe down by 1 tablespoon to keep the sweet factor down to balance the custard. Beautiful crust, buttery and caramelized nicely contrasting with the tart sweetness of the smooth custard! Yum. Made it for friends after a Gumbo dinner and it complemented nicely!!

Pie has the delicious, distinctive key lime flavor. The filling texture is very light due to the egg whites being folded in. Would like a creamier filling so will try the recipe that uses only the egg yolks.

Excellent! The only changes I made were to use more graham crackers in my crust and I did not use melted butter, but softened butter. This makes the crust much easier to work with and gives a nicer all around crust. Anyway, beyond that I made it as written (using bottled, real key lime juice). My husband is a key lime pie addict and absolutely loved this pie!
I made it as written and thought it was great!

I followed this recipe completely as written except the pie crust. I followed another reviewer's suggestions and used 1.5 cups graham crakers, 6 T butter, 1/4 cup sugar. 

The pie comes out very fluffy and has an awesome texture (if you like fluffy pies!) but is extremely tart!! I've never really had key lime pie before, so I don't know how tart it's supposed to be. 

Some other reviewers stated there wasn't enough filling for a 9" pie pan, but I guess with the thicker crust this isn't a problem because mine filled up to the top perfectly and did not overflow. I ended up baking it for about 16 minutes.

My husband is crazy about key lime pie, and this one made him very happy! It is delicious and easy to make. The only labor-intensive part is squeezing those tiny limes, but if you do that ahead of time, the rest of the pie comes together quickly. Highly recommend!

PERFECT! I could not find "Key Limes" so I used 2 Limes and 2 Lemons and it gave me 1/2 Cup and turned out PERFECT...my guests could not believe I didn't use real Key Limes. 

I topped it with a "Sour Cream Whipped Cream" i found on this site...was a perfect match. (3/4C whipping cream, 1/4C sour cream, 1/2-1tsp Vanilla, and 1/4C conf Sugar *i used less sugar*)

This is a lighter key lime pie, not as dense as most. You basically get all of the flavor without much of the guilt, which is perfect. I'll definitely be making this again! My notes on the recipe: I made some adjustments to the crust as well. I eliminated the sugar, and like other reviewers, I reduced the butter to 4T, or 1/4 cup. For the rest of the recipe, I followed the directions as written, except I added 1 tsp grated lime zest. I allowed the pie to cool for 30 minutes before placing it in the refrigerator for an hour. I then froze the pie for one hour before serving, and the consistency was excellent.

I'm usually not a fan of lemon or lime flavored thing, but this pie was very good! Waiting for it to freeze is crucial for the consistency to be right. We used cool whip instead of heavy whipping cream for the decorative topping, and it worked out just fine, probably even easier to do. This pie is a perfect summer treat.

My husband lived in Florida for many years and is a key lime pie aficionado. I have tried many recipes over the years, and none have succeeded, until now. I used a regular pie crust instead of a graham cracker crust, and I also added 1/2 tsp of vanilla and 3 tbs of powdered sugar to the whipped cream topping. He is absolutely thrilled! Thanks IRENED for the recipe!
Excellent! I did add a pinch of salt to the crust and some lime zest to the top. Great recipe!!

Made this yesterday for Easter and it was absolutely fabulous. I made it exactly like it called for...just put out on the counter about 45 min before eating to dethaw. I also added a bit of green food coloring as I don't like the "yellow" color or key lime pie.

Everyone loved it and said it was the best they ever had! Will definitely be making this again!

i have made this pie many many times. Everyone loves this pie. it really is the best key lime pie i have ever tasted. The only thing i change is that i need more grahm crackers. I use about a 1/2 cup more. i also add another tablesoon of butter to the crust. The only problem ive been having recently, is that the crust sticks to the bottom. i have tried many ways, but i cant seem to make it not stick. but the crust is what makes this pie so amazing im not going to change it :) definately worth the hassle. id like to address the reviews where people were saying this pie was light and airey. It is not, i dont know why your pie was doing that, but mine always come out smooth and creamy. i dont use fresh lime juice, i use key lime juice from a bottle that i buy at the grocery, ive never tried it with any other kind of lime juice or fresh limes.
Not my most favorite, but it was good. It was a bit too cheese like for my taste. Not so silky & creamy. Good lime flavor though.

Oh my goodness this was good! All tasters rated it a keeper. We couldn't wait to try it, so we had some on the same day it was made, and finished it off the next day. There was unanimous agreement - wait until day 2 to eat it. As others have said, the flavor is much better if you have the patience to wait! Thanks for the recipe!
I am not an expert on the key lime pie, but husband said it was delicious.

Great recipe! Two things though...the crust turns out a bit thin, so it is best to double the recipe, and I added a tablespoon of sugar to the topping to sweeten it up a bit as it is a little bland on its own.
Great recipe!! I made it twice in a week because it was liked so well.
use cool whip instead of homemade and spray pan before baking crust

This pie gets invited to more parties than I do! It is absolutely delicious-- rich and refreshing at the same time. I suggest the following changes: bake for 30-45 minutes, and remove from the oven when the center is still wobbly (like a cheesecake). Let cool at room temperature (the pie finishes cooking as it cools), then refrigerate overnight-- do not freeze! Thanks for a great recipe!
Delish! I use half lime juice and half lemon juice, as reccomended, and make my own pie crust. This is a huge hit each time I serve it.

Closely resembles the frozen key lime pie at the Lime Inn on St. John USVI. Even with storebought graham cracker crust and canned whipped cream, we thought it was excellent. My family likes it fully frozen; I let my slice defrost a bit first. We prefer this lighter texture over the typical custard.
Very good. Didn't have key limes, used regular. Key limes would be even better. This will be my Key Lime pie recipe.

Well, you may think it strange that I am rating this 5 stars when in all honesty I didn't even take a bite. But I entered it in a dessert contest that had LOTS of entries and it won 2nd place (and was subsequently devoured before I could get to it). So, with that feedback and the the raving I heard from the judges (amazing! perfect tartness, etc.), I feel comfortable giving it 5 stars. I made more crust (as one reviewer suggested: 1 1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs, 1/4 cup sugar and 6 Tbl butter) but other than that, followed the recipe exactly. I am going to make another one and keep it for myself:-)

Whipping the egg whites results in a lighter more airy texture which isn't the traditional key lime pie I was expecting. Compare to other similar recipes and you will note they don't whip the egg whites.
This turned out fantastic, my first attempt at making a homemade pie. This is a great recipe and it taste fantastic!
I made this for a dinner party and had requests for another pie and the recipie the next day!

This was my first key lime pie and it was delicious! I used an already prepared graham cracker crust, and for some reason the bottom of the crust got too moist and didn't want to stay intact when cutting the pie and removing it from the pan. Not sure how to combat that. But the pie was super yummy!
I have never made or even eaten Key lime pie before but this was AWESOME!!! The whole family is still raving about it weeks later!
Wonderful! My first time making Key Lime Pie. Made 2 for my brother's BDay. One for the party and one for him to take home. I'm not sure if the 2nd made it home uneaten!

Excellent! I used 1/4 c. lemon and 1/4 c. lime juice since I couldn't find the key limes here in Ohio. I grated some rind from both and sprinkled a little on top of each slice along with the whipped cream... beautiful presentation, great flavor, highly recommend this recipe!

Yes, this is a great recipe! The first key lime pie and I have no need to look further. It is simple, light, fluffy, perfect level of tart and sweetness. I used a premade graham crust, and whipped cream from a can and it was delish! Next time I will add some fresh lime zest as well! Also I didn't freeze the pie but for a few minutes prior to serving for easier slicing.

Yes, this is a great recipe! The first key lime pie and I have no need to look further. It is simple, light, fluffy, perfect level of tart and sweetness. I used a premade graham crust, and whipped cream from a can and it was delish! Next time I will add some fresh lime zest as well! Also I didn't freeze the pie but for a few minutes prior to serving for easier slicing.
This was a huge hit for Mother's Day! I baked it for 30 minutes to make sure it was set - no freezing necessary.
This is a delicious key lime pie. The addition of the egg whites makes this pie particularly creamy. I may use a tad less lime next time.

Excellent Key Lime Pie. The first time I tried this recipe I substituted the key lime with lemon/lime juice, and while still pretty good, doesn't compare to the second and subsequent times I've prepared this pie using the authentic key lime juice. One thing I'd like to add for everyone commenting on the color, it isn't supposed to be green! A true key lime pie is yellow, so please don't feel that you should be adding dye to an otherwise lovely pie.
Great pie!! Everyone loved it! I made a batch and a half of the filling and added green food coloring. It was very refreshing frozen and still good refridegrated.
1 word. YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It was super good.
Everyone in my family loved it!
First time for me to make key lime pie....everyone who had a slice said "YUMMY"!!!!! Thanks for the recipe! I will definitely keep this recipe.
I made one pie and did not care for it. I thought I had made it wrong and made a second one... nope. Just didn't care for it. Will not make it again
This was perfect... served it with whipped cream from a can and fresh blueberries. I'm not looking for another recipe!

This is a great pie to make when the pantry is low and time is of the essence. It's light, pretty, and tastes great. Cut the calories by finishing with non-dairy whipped topping, or modify by adding coconut to make this recipe your own.

Wonderful, true to Key West, Key Lime Pie! This is the first recipe I have followed to a T from allrecipes.com. I usually have to add/delete something to make it more appealing to me. Anyways, delicious dessert!

Made this for my boyfriend for his birthday! He loved it... and even though he was full.. he had more! The amount of filling was perfect! I might use a few more graham crumbs, a little more sugar, and a bit more butter so that the crust is thick enough!

Fantabulous! Easy and yummy! I took KRANEY's suggestion about the crust and it turned out great. Also i used 4 egg whites instead of 2, and used a little more the 1/4 lime juice and little less than 1/4 lemon juice. It was just marvelous! Thank you so very mcuh for sharing the recipe!
Awesome pie!! Delish!!

This is a nice and light key lime pie recipe. I used to make key lime pie with egg yolks only and it was much heavier and more custardy. The first time I made this pie I didn't freeze it and the filling was too soft (about the consistency of whipped cream - light and fluffy but didn't taste like a pie). Now I always freeze it to make it firmer and I serve it right out of the freezer. The texture is perfect - exactly what you'd expect for a key lime pie but without all the extra egg yolks. It's a great recipe for summer since it's cold like ice cream. I wouldn't recommend using this recipe if you don't plan on freezing it. I also chose to use a pre-made pie crust because graham crackers have high fructose corn syrup while the pre-made pie crust does not.

Everybody loved this pie. Out of the eight pies I made this one definitely went the fastest. Super easy, too. I've tried key lime before and have a hard time having them set up, but this one was perfectly firm. Yummy!
Great pie - filling could be a bit lighter. I added more a bit more whipped egg whites to the second one I made and it was delicious.
